name: Quindar
headline: The platform to monitor and automate satellite operations
description:
Quindar is a web app used by satellite owners to analyze, test and operate their constellation. For example, Airbus could use Quindar to operate their satellite fleet with minimal human intervention.

We’re six former OneWeb engineers who helped build the software platform that currently operates the second largest satellite constellation in the world.

The space industry is shifting from companies launching a handful of satellites over a decade, to launching hundreds of satellites EACH in just a few years. Our SaaS platform automates mission management and for a single engineer to operate hundreds of satellites instead of the traditional model of many engineers operating a single satellite.

founders.name: Nate Hamet, Founder
founders.description: I'm one of the co-founders and CEO of Quindar. I've worked in the space industry for almost a decade doing electrical, software, and mission design for Lockheed Martin, OneWeb, and Orbital Effects. At OneWeb I helped architect the TT&C ground system that operates the second largest satellite constellation today. I went to undergrad and grad school at the University of Michigan studying aerospace and meteorology. In my free time I love to cook, travel, and participate in sports.

founders.name: Sunny Bhagavathula, Founder
founders.description: I am an astrodynamicist with experience flying telecommunication and Earth-observation satellites. After grad school at Michigan, I helped architect and build two high-fidelity flight dynamics systems with an emphasis on space sustainability. I am excited about lowering the barrier to orbit and providing tools for satellite owners to be responsible users of space through Quindar. Outside of work, I love to spend time playing and watching sports, rock climbing, cycling, and hiking.

founders.name: David Lawrence, Founder
founders.description: Dave Lawrence studied Aerospace Engineering at Texas A&M and since then has helped design and operate satellite systems at several companies, including Boeing, Iridium, and OneWeb. He has led in-orbit commissioning and systems integration campaigns for communications and earth observations satellites. He'll bring this experience to Quindar to build a satellite operations platform that enables access to space!

founders.name: Zach Meza, Founder
founders.description: I am a software engineer with a B.S. in Computer Science from Stanford University with a concentration in Artificial Intelligence. Since graduating in 2016 I've worked on two satellite missions to develop the programs' mission operations software from the ground up; the software I've written to is still in use to operate the satellites and orchestrate the ground systems. At Quindar I serve as Head of Software alongside my five fellow cofounders, with whom I have worked for the last six years.

founders.name: Shaishav Parekh, Founder
founders.description: A software engineer with a B.S. in Computer Engineering from Virginia Tech, Shai has worked as a consultant for Red Hat and gained industry experience in Finance, Insurance, O&G and Retail industries. He helped design the OneWeb satellite operations software and went on the build the scheduling software for another Earth Observation satellite operator. Outside of work he enjoys playing tennis, watching F1 and hiking.

founders.name: Matt Regan, Founder
founders.description: I'm an aerospace engineer by study and a software engineer by trade. Since entering the workforce I've worked at a myriad of satellite and space missions from defense satellites to mega-consteallation for global internet. I am particularly excited about participating in the latest space revolution and working towards lowering the barrier of space for all interested parties. Outside of work, I'll usually spend time with friends, playing soccer, or watching any Michigan game. Go Blue!

## Unified Operations
Control multiple satellite types in a single interface allowing for legacy fleet migration and next-gen payload support. Track spacecraft, reserve contacts, automate tasking, and intelligently respond to ground and space incidents with Quindar Mission Management.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/639310b2b84b24293ddda440/65b794462b4968e90cfb0f0c_home_about-image1.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/639310b2b84b24293ddda440/65bc2016577bdc0d282799ac_home_about-image2.png)
## Intelligent Insights
Сoming soon
Harness the power of advanced analytics and machine learning to turn data into actionable intelligence. Make decisions faster via predictive maintenance, trend analysis, and anomaly detection. Leveraging data-driven insights that propel your mission forward.
## Open Architecture
Built to integrate seamlessly with your existing systems and third-party applications. As your needs evolve, your operations can too without the constraint of vendor lock-in.

Start to design and simulate your mission while your competition is busy building it from the ground up.

## Go to market Faster.
Accelerate your schedule by skipping software development with our ready-to-use cloud services and partner integrations. Focus on your payload operations.
[Learn more](https://www.quindar.space/<https:/calendly.com/nate-hamet/quindar-intro>)

## Unified Operations
Control multiple satellite types in a single interface allowing for legacy fleet migration and next-gen payload support. Track spacecraft, reserve contacts, automate tasking, and intelligently respond to ground and space incidents with Quindar Mission Management.
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/639310b2b84b24293ddda440/65b794462b4968e90cfb0f0c_home_about-image1.png)
![](https://cdn.prod.website-files.com/639310b2b84b24293ddda440/65bc2016577bdc0d282799ac_home_about-image2.png)
## Intelligent Insights
Сoming soon
Harness the power of advanced analytics and machine learning to turn data into actionable intelligence. Make decisions faster via predictive maintenance, trend analysis, and anomaly detection. Leveraging data-driven insights that propel your mission forward.
## Open Architecture
Built to integrate seamlessly with your existing systems and third-party applications. As your needs evolve, your operations can too without the constraint of vendor lock-in.

generated_description:
Quindar is a cutting-edge platform revolutionizing satellite operations. Founded in 2022 by six former OneWeb engineers, Quindar's mission is to provide a seamless environment for monitoring and automating satellite missions. Think of it as Google Docs for satellites—where multiple operators can manage fleets without getting buried under the weight of traditional complexities.

The space landscape is changing rapidly; once, managing satellites meant launching a few every decade. Now, we're in an era where companies are rolling out hundreds of satellites in just a few years! Quindar's Software as a Service (SaaS) platform is designed for this rapid expansion. It allows a single engineer to operate hundreds of satellites—a significant leap from the old method where many engineers were needed for just one satellite. 

Based in Denver, Colorado, Quindar is part of Y Combinator's S22 batch, securing initial funding that speaks volumes about its potential. Their offering includes services like Mission Planning, Command & Control, Flight Dynamics, and Incident Management, tailored for satellite owners, manufacturers, and defense organizations.

What sets Quindar apart is not just its technology but also the team's deep industry experience. They come from backgrounds that include helping build the software platform behind the second largest satellite constellation in the world. 

Their platform stands out with an open architecture, making it easy to integrate with existing systems—essential for companies that want to scale without being tied down by vendor lock-in. 

The company is moving fast, with over 250 satellites in their management backlog and a promise of up to 99% Service Level Agreements (SLAs). With advancements in analytics and machine learning on the horizon, their goal is to provide actionable insights that will redefine satellite mission management.

So, if you're looking to streamline your satellite operations and stay ahead in the space race, Quindar is worth checking out. You can learn more about their offerings at [Quindar's website](https://www.quindar.space).
